title: Authors and Citation
text: Angel Robles. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Robles (2024). plus: Positive unlabeled Learning Unbalanced cases Sparse structures. R package version 0.0.1, https://alrobles.github.io/plus/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {plus: Positive and unlabeled Learning from Unbalanced cases and Sparse structures},   author = {Angel Robles},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://alrobles.github.io/plus/}, }

what: Positive and unlabeled Learning from Unbalanced cases and Sparse structures
title: Positive and unlabeled Learning from Unbalanced cases and Sparse structures
text: Positive unlabeled Learning Unbalanced cases Sparse structures (PLUS)

title: Positive and unlabeled Learning from Unbalanced cases and Sparse structures
text: can install development version plus GitHub : goal plus implement Positive unlabeled Learning Unbalanced cases Sparse structures (PLUS) algorithm, originally published : PLoS ## Example use plus simple: can predict new data: Additionally can get evaluation performance metrics plus models plus algorithm can applied different datasets
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("alrobles/plus") library(plus) data(binexample) x = binexample$x y = binexample$y plus(x, y) #>  #> Call:  glmnet::cv.glmnet(x = train.X, y = y, family = "binomial")  #>  #> Measure: Binomial Deviance  #>  #>       Lambda Index Measure      SE Nonzero #> min 0.005152    37  0.2948 0.08232      15 #> 1se 0.014335    26  0.3687 0.07902      11 data(binexample) x = binexample$x y = binexample$y train <- sample(seq(length(y)), 85, replace = FALSE) x_train <- x[train, ] x_test  <- x[-train, ] y_train <- y[train] y_test  <- y[-train] fit <- plus(x_train, y_train) predict(fit, newx = x_test) #>       lambda.min #>  [1,]  0.9983758 #>  [2,]  0.9825414 #>  [3,]  0.9629690 #>  [4,]  0.9304139 #>  [5,]  0.9991706 #>  [6,]  0.9831281 #>  [7,]  0.9969993 #>  [8,]  0.9978295 #>  [9,]  0.9875074 #> [10,]  0.9968640 #> [11,]  0.9727998 #> [12,]  0.9855236 #> [13,]  0.9949839 #> [14,]  0.9836214 #> [15,]  0.9626422 #> [1] 0.36 #> $deviance #> lambda.min  #>   1.473088  #>  #> $class #> lambda.min  #>        0.4  #>  #> $auc #> [1] 0.36 #>  #> $mse #> lambda.min  #>  0.5363815  #>  #> $mae #> lambda.min  #>  0.9601982

what: Assessment of performance metrics in plus models — assess
title: Assessment of performance metrics in plus models — assess
text: Assessment performance metrics plus models

title: Assessment of performance metrics in plus models — assess
code: assess(object, newx = NULL, newy, weights = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for class 'plus' assess(object, newx = NULL, newy, weights = NULL, ...)

title: Assessment of performance metrics in plus models — assess
text: object plus object newx matrix new data test performance newy vector observed classes test performance weights optional vector case weights ... additional arguments

title: Assessment of performance metrics in plus models — assess
text: list performance metrics plus models

title: Assessment of performance metrics in plus models — assess
code: x_train <- matrix(rnorm(650 * 20), 650, 20) x_test  <- matrix(rnorm(350 * 20), 350, 20) y_train <- ifelse(rnorm(650) > 0, 1, 0) y_test  <- ifelse(rnorm(350) > 0, 1, 0) fit <- plus(x_train, y_train) #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf assess(fit, newx = x_test, newy = y_test) #> $deviance #> lambda.min  #>   1.678749  #>  #> $class #> lambda.min  #>  0.5514286  #>  #> $auc #> [1] 0.5425233 #>  #> $mse #> lambda.min  #>  0.6326384  #>  #> $mae #> lambda.min  #>   1.039667  #>

what: Gets the Area under ROC curve usingthe concordance statistics — auc
title: Gets the Area under ROC curve usingthe concordance statistics — auc
text: Gets Area ROC curve usingthe concordance statistics

title: Gets the Area under ROC curve usingthe concordance statistics — auc
Gets the Area under ROC curve usingthe concordance statistics — auc
text: y vector binary clases prob vector probabilities (logistic regression output) w optional vector case weights

title: Gets the Area under ROC curve usingthe concordance statistics — auc
text: AUC value plus object

title: Gets the Area under ROC curve usingthe concordance statistics — auc
code: x_train <- matrix(rnorm(650 * 20), 650, 20) x_test  <- matrix(rnorm(350 * 20), 350, 20) y_train <- ifelse(rnorm(650) > 0, 1, 0) y_test  <- ifelse(rnorm(350) > 0, 1, 0) fit <- plus(x_train, y_train) #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf p_response <- plus:::predict.plus(fit, newx = x_test) p_class <- plus:::predict.plus(fit, newx = x_test, type = "class") auc(p_class, p_response) #> [1] 1

what: AUC evaluation for matrix (data.frame) data — auc_matrix
title: AUC evaluation for matrix (data.frame) data — auc_matrix
text: AUC evaluation matrix (data.frame) data

title: AUC evaluation for matrix (data.frame) data — auc_matrix
AUC evaluation for matrix (data.frame) data — auc_matrix
text: y Label binary class vector prob probability output weights optional vector case weights

title: AUC evaluation for matrix (data.frame) data — auc_matrix
text: matrix AUC values

title: AUC evaluation for matrix (data.frame) data — auc_matrix
code: x_train <- matrix(rnorm(650 * 20), 650, 20) x_test  <- matrix(rnorm(350 * 20), 350, 20) y_train <- ifelse(rnorm(650) > 0, 1, 0) y_test  <- ifelse(rnorm(350) > 0, 1, 0) fit <- plus(x_train, y_train) p_response <- predict(fit, newx = x_test) p_class <- plus:::predict.plus(fit, newx = x_test, type = "class") p_class <- as.matrix(p_class) auc_matrix(p_class, p_response) #> [1] 0.5

what: List with 100 random values for binary classfication It contains a list with x and y values. x.has 100 instances and 30 features. y is a vector of 100 binary (1 and 0) values. This dataset is for test plus classification. — binexample

what: Data frame with 5990 abstracts. Each abstract belongs to one of both classes, positive and unknown. Abstracts from parasite class are from ZOVER and GMPD database. Abstracs from unknown class are random abstracts retrived from crossref. — lacs
title: Data frame with 5990 abstracts. Each abstract belongs to one of both classes, positive and unknown. Abstracts from parasite class are from ZOVER and GMPD database. Abstracs from unknown class are random abstracts retrived from crossref. — lacs

text: Evaluation metric plus classification

title: Evaluation metric of plus classification — plus_cv_lognet
code: plus_cv_lognet(   predmat,   y,   type.measure = c("deviance", "class", "auc", "mse", "mae"),   weights = NULL )

title: Evaluation metric of plus classification — plus_cv_lognet
text: predmat prediction matrix given plus model (lambda min) y vector binary virable test performance type.measure type performance metric ("deviance", "class", "auc", "mse", "mae") weights optional vector case weights

title: Evaluation metric of plus classification — plus_cv_lognet
text: type.measure AUC returns auc value. Otherwise returna vector values given metrics.

title: Evaluation metric of plus classification — plus_cv_lognet
code: x_train <- matrix(rnorm(650 * 20), 650, 20) x_test  <- matrix(rnorm(350 * 20), 350, 20) y_train <- ifelse(rnorm(650) > 0, 1, 0) y_test  <- ifelse(rnorm(350) > 0, 1, 0) fit <- plus(x_train, y_train) #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to max; returning -Inf #> Warning: no non-missing arguments to min; returning Inf p <- predict(fit,newx = x_test) plus_cv_lognet(p, y_test, type.measure = "auc") #> $cvraw #>           [,1] #> [1,] 0.5328174 #>  #> $weights #>   1  #> 350  #>  #> $N #> [1] 1 #>  #> $type.measure #> [1] "auc" #>

make predictions from a
text: make predictions "plus" object. function makes predictions plus object. essence cross-validated glmnet model, optimized plus algorithm. use optimal value chosen lambda fit.

title: make predictions from a
code: # S3 method for class 'plus' predict(object, ..., newx = NULL, s = "lambda.min", type = "response")

title: make predictions from a
text: object Fitted "pluse" object. ... additional predict arguments newx Matrix new values x predictions made. Must matrix; can sparse Matrix package. s Value(s) penalty parameter lambda predictions required. Default value s="lambda.min" stored CV object. Alternatively s="lambda.1se" can used. s numeric, taken value(s) lambda used. (historical reasons use symbol 's' rather 'lambda' reference parameter) type Type prediction required. Type "link" gives linear predictors "binomial". Type "response" gives fitted probabilities "binomial". Type "coefficients" computes coefficients requested values s. Type "class" produces class label corresponding maximum probability. Type "nonzero" returns list indices nonzero coefficients value s.
